text.section:
An investigating committee shall have the chairman and vice chairman who:
are appointed by the resolution that establishes the investigating committee; or
if the resolution does not appoint these officers, are elected by affirmative vote of a majority of all of the members of the investigating committee.
The rules of an investigating committee shall provide for the selection of a presiding officer to act if the chairman and the vice chairman are absent or unable to act.

section.section:
At a hearing of an investigating committee, the presiding officer shall be:
the chairman of the investigating committee;
if the chairman is absent or otherwise unable to preside, the vice chairman; or
if the chairman and vice chairman are absent or otherwise unable to preside, the individual who is selected under the rules of the investigating committee.

At a hearing, the presiding officer:
shall examine the witnesses or supervise the examination by any other member of the investigating committee or by staff who are authorized to examine witnesses; and
may direct a witness to answer a relevant question or to provide a relevant book, document, or paper.
